snippet: State officials fear that Washington’s efforts to tame the federal deficit could end up further whittling away the federal aid that states depend upon.
abstract: State officials fear that federal deficit-cutting measures will negate state revenue gains that had been projected to climb back to prerecession levels for first time since financial crisis hit.
lead_paragraph: State officials fear that Washington’s efforts to tame the federal deficit could end up further whittling away the federal aid that states depend upon.

headline.main: As State Budgets Rebound, Federal Cuts Could Pose Danger
headline.print_headline: As State Budgets Rebound, Federal Cuts Could Pose Danger

keywords.value: National Assn of State Budget Officers
